name: Tayra
description: Eira, tayra, hyrare, or Brazilian marten—all names for this elegant, slender mustelid from Central and South America. With its long, bushy tail and head shape, it resembles its close relatives, the martens. When sunlight reflects off its lighter head fur, it shines like gold.
spread_note: Mexico to northern Argentina and Trinidad
proportions: Body length: 56–68 cm, tail 37.5–40 cm, weight: 4–5 kg
attractions: Like all mustelids, it is highly adaptable, building dens in tree hollows, dense undergrowth, or rock crevices. It climbs trees skillfully, often hunting small clawed monkeys, while on the ground it seeks rodents or reptiles.
breeding: We’ve kept tayras in Prague Zoo since 2004, with the first successful breeding in 2011.
